thread.title: China’s Alibaba Adds to Food-Delivery Bet

author: Liza Lin
title: China’s Alibaba Adds to Food-Delivery Bet

organizations.name: ant small and micro financial services group co.

text:
0 COMMENTS Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. BABA -1.92% , further diversifying beyond e-commerce, said it would acquire a Chinese online delivery platform.
The Chinese internet giant said Monday that it will buy out all the shares outstanding of Ele.me it doesn’t already own in a deal that values the Shanghai-based company at $9.5 billion. Ele.me delivers takeout food as well as groceries and household items.
The acquisition will help Alibaba, which runs China’s two largest e-commerce platforms, advance in brick-and-mortar retail and local services. Since 2016, the Hangzhou-based company has sought to expand beyond its core e-commerce business —where it faces slowing growth and intensifying competition—into serving physical stores.
Alibaba and its affiliate Ant Small and Micro Financial Services Group Co. currently own about 43% of the outstanding voting shares of Ele.me. Alibaba Chief Executive Officer Daniel Zhang said in an email to staff that Ele.me would complement its Yelp-like online platform Koubei.
The deal sharpens the competition between Alibaba and rival Tencent Holdings , which backs Meituan-Dianping, a large startup that runs a competing online food-delivery service.
Write to Liza Lin at Liza.Lin@wsj.com
